summary: The diff largely implements the requested Reddit-style pond layout: PondPage shows Feed/About tabs on mobile only and introduces a new PondAboutSidebar for the right column on desktop; PondAboutPage makes the tabs mobile-only as well. One potential gap is that PondPage’s loading and “pond not found” desktop right column still renders the generic RightSidebar rather than pond-specific About content.

missing_requirements.requirement: At viewport width >= `lg`, the right column on PondPage shows pond-specific About content (not Trending Ponds / Popular Tags / Hot This Week).
missing_requirements.reason: In PondPage, the desktop right column renders the generic <RightSidebar /> in at least the loading and not-found branches, so the right column is not consistently pond-specific at `lg` and up.
evidence: frontend/src/pages/PondPage.tsx (loading state renders <RightSidebar /> in right aside)
frontend/src/pages/PondPage.tsx (not-found state renders <RightSidebar /> in right aside)

hallucinated_features.description: Added a desktop-only “Back to Feed” button on the Pond About page.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-4 only asks to remove the Feed/About tabs on desktop and avoid redundant desktop-only navigation; it does not request adding new navigation controls.
evidence: frontend/src/pages/PondAboutPage.tsx (hidden lg:block Back to Feed button using ArrowLeft + navigate)
